item.title: 2017 Workshop for SF6 Emission Reduction Strategies
item.description:
January 24–25, 2017, Embassy Suites by Hilton San Francisco Airport Waterfront

Save the Date!
Final Agenda

See below for a list of topics which will be covered in the workshop.

  • US Reporting Program & Nameplate Capacity Accuracy
  • SF6 Handling – International Perspective
  • Leak Detection and Repair
  • SF6 Alternatives
  • Best Management Practices for SF6 Leak Detection, Repair and Tracking
  • Safety and Environmental Awareness of SF6 Byproducts
  • Southern California Edison Case Study: SF6 Inventory Management Challenges
  • State and International Climate Regulation Update

Workshop Program:

January 23: Registration in the evening
January 24: Full day—Registration in the morning and presentations
January 25: Half day—Presentations and site tour with SF6 Partner Pacific Gas and Electric Company

The final workshop agenda has been developed. Please note, that the agenda is subject to change. 

Registration

Registration has closed as of 1/13. Onsite registration will be offered based on availability. Please email ElectricPower-SF6@icfi.com to notify us in advance if you have not pre-registered and plan to register onsite.

  • Registration Fee for Workshop: $120
  • Registration fee for Workshop plus Site Tour: $170

Site Tour

As of 12/16/16, the site tour is sold out and we are no longer collecting names for the waitlist. If space becomes available, we will contact waitlist registrants to be added to the tour.

Please join SF6 Partner, Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E), on a tour of our San Mateo Substation. The tour will cover safety considerations for the tour, federal and state SF6 compliance requirements as they pertain to Electric Substations. PG&E will provide a tour that will cover the sites Gas Insulated Switchgear (GIS) as well as SF6 Cylinder weighing. San Mateo Substation is a NERC certified facility so space is limited to 35 participants. The cost for the site tour is $50, and includes lunch. The site tour will take place after the workshop events are complete on January 25.

We have several requirements for attendees of the site tour, based on safety and procedural protocols. Note, you will not be allowed on the site tour without all of these items. Please contact us if you need assistance with the clothing requirements—PG&E may be able to assist with some of these requirements but advanced notice is necessary.

  1. Bring a valid, government issued, ID with you on the tour. Acceptable examples include a Driver’s License or Passport.
  2. Site Tour Clothing Requirements
    • FR coveralls or clothing
    • Protective eyewear
    • Hard hat
    • High-top leather boots
    • Ear Plugs

The site tour is currently at full capacity. If your plans have changed, and you no longer can attend the site tour, please email ElectricPower-SF6@icfi.com so that those on the waiting list can be considered for attendance.

Hotel Room Block

The host hotel for the 2017 EPA SF6 Workshop will be the Embassy Suites by Hilton San Francisco Airport Waterfront Hotel.Exit We have reserved a discounted block of rooms at a group rate of $219 plus tax. Room reservations must be made by Wednesday, January 4 to qualify for our discounted rate.

Instructions on booking the room:

  • Call 800-EMBASSY (362-2779) and request the reservation by unique code EPA or ask for the EPA SF6 Emission group rate.
  • Book your hotel room online:
    1. www.sfoburlingame.embassysuites.com Exit
    2. Fill in all the information requested (i.e., arrival and departure dates)
    3. Select the Blue Link that says "Add Special Rate Code"
    4. An Additional drop down screen appears, and in the "Group Code" Box type in: EPA
    5. Now click "Check rooms and rates" and your group information populates for them to book!

Exhibitors

We will have exhibitor tables in the room adjacent to the workshop room. Registration for exhibitors has closed as of 1/13. Please email ElectricPower-SF6@icfi.com with additional questions.
item.dc:creator: xsmichen

item.title: Electric Power Systems Service Provider Directory
item.description:
List Your Company

Please contact the Partnership if you would like your company to be listed in the Service Provider Directory.

The Service Provider Directory shares information on service and technology providers that can facilitate SF6 emission reduction activities.  EPA does not endorse particular companies or products.

  • SF6 Recycling Equipment
  • Laser Leak Detection - Leak Detection Equipment/Services
  • SF6 Gas Monitoring, Measurement & Handling Services
  • SF6 Gas Equipment Leak Repair

SF6 Recycling Equipment

SF6 recycling equipment can recover and remove impurities from the gas, enabling its re-use and thereby reduce the demand for new SF6. The following companies provide SF6 recycling services, training and technology for purchase.

Company Address City State Zip Country Contact
ABB Inc. 100 Distribution Circle Mount Pleasant PA 15666 USA (724) 696-1381 (Phone)
(724) 696-1379 (Fax)

(931) 526-2219 (Fax)

(951) 677-2066 (Fax)

Laser Leak Detection - Leak Detection Equipment/Services

Laser leak detection systems exploit the strong infrared absorption characteristics of SF6, enabling the operator to identify even the smallest leaks at distances as great as 50 feet away, without taking equipment out of service. The following companies offer laser leak detection services and/or equipment for purchase.

Top of Page

SF6 Gas Monitoring, Measurement & Handling Services

Critical to any successful emission reduction strategy is proper management and handling. In addition to their role as SF6 gas suppliers, the following companies offer SF6 gas management and handling services for electric utilities. Some of these services are in the form of customized programs that include SF6 training on environmental awareness, gas cart operation and gas handling, as well as SF6 management in the form of SF6 inventory control, recycling, gas analysis, delivery and disposal.
